body.note: Cryptographic keys are classified as SECRET data and must be treated as such.

section.title: Algorithm
section.p: Data is encrypted using the AES algorithm and 256-bit keys.

Encryption is implemented using a two-tiered architecture. In order to mitigate the risk of any single key becoming lost, broken, or substituted, the system maintains a list of twenty-five, separate keys.
Data is encrypted using a random key from the list and is subsequently stored in the database.
Microsoft's RandomNumberGenerator is used to generate random key data.
